To properly drain an exterior hosebib:

1) Turn water on from the outside at the
hosebib

2) Turn off the water inside the home at
the cutoff valve

3) If the cutoff valve is equipped with an
air bleeder valve or "vacuum breaker", be
sure to loosen this to allow all water to
escape. (Hint: Place a small cup or glass
under the fitting as some water may leak
at this point)
4) Return outside and depress the "anti-siphon" device if installed with your home to relieve any trapped water
Note: Newer building codes require the use of "stop & waste" type valves for hosebib drain valves.
The shutoff valve should have a bleeder valve that will allow air back through the pipe when drained.
It is almost like placing your finger over the top of a drinking straw. Until air can pass through the
top of the pipe, water will be trapped inside!
